thread.title: Tennessee DL takes medical exemption, ends career
thread.title_full: Tennessee DL takes medical exemption, ends career

title: Tennessee DL takes medical exemption, ends career
text:
Tennessee defensive end Andrew Butcher battles offensive lineman Dylan Wiesman during the 2015 Orange and White Game. (Photo: Adam Lau, Knoxville News Sentinel) 
A highly touted defensive lineman’s career at Tennessee has ended before it ever really started. 
Rising third-year sophomore defensive end Andrew Butcher took to Twitter on Monday night to confirm suspicions that he would take a medical exemption to remain on scholarship but end his football career at Tennessee. 
(Want the latest scoop on Tennessee football and basketball? Make sure you're in the loop — take five seconds to sign up for our FREE Vols newsletter now!) 
Butcher, the nation’s No. 269 overall prospect and No. 17 strongside defensive end prospect in the 2015 industry-generated 247Sports Composite, redshirted as a true freshman in 2015 and sat out the 2016 season while continuing to battle through knee injuries that required four surgeries. 
The former Alpharetta (Ga.) High School star thanked Tennessee fans who followed his career and apologized that it didn’t work out the way he and so many others expected. 
(Buy one month of GoVols247 VIP access and GET TWO MONTHS FREE .) 
“After 2 years with this amazing program, today, I have taken a medical exemption that ends my football career at UT,” Butcher tweeted. “I have had 4 surgeries, 2 major on the same knee. It is in my best interest and UT’s to take this optjon. UT will stand behind me, and I will get my degree from this great University. 
“Thank you to all of those who followed my career, and am sorry it did not turn out like I had hoped when I got here. I will always cherish my time being a part of this program.” — Andrew Butcher (@ButcherAndrew1) February 6, 2017 
The 6-foot-2, 257-pound Butcher was a big part of Tennessee’s 2015 signing class, but he struggled to get on the field and stay on the field while battling injuries. Many efforts were made to get Butcher’s situation straightened out, but ultimately his health wouldn’t cooperate.
